text: I have to build a 20 TIX Jenara deck :stuck_out_tongue: Any auto-suggestions?
Hardened Scales
Jenara.
DEAN'S HELPING
I'm always helping.
LOL, damn, I almost forgot her :stuck_out_tongue: Yeah, hardened Scales is a definite must-have. I'm debating a Doubling Season, but I don't think I want to sink that much budget for it
Gilder Bairn, Vorel
The Abzan card that gives +1/+1 countered creatures trample?
Ha. Well played Dean
Ha, that's hilarious. I never knew that existed. What do you use to tap him?
What's that card that doubles all your +1/+1 counters and makes those creatures indestructible?
Can always just attack and untap. It's edh, there's often a safe target, and if not it's often still worth to double Jenara
Or am I getting two cards mixed up?
No, it came out in Theros, I think, because it has Ajani and Elspeth on it
Yeah, that's true
[[Inspiring Call] is similar
[[solidarity of heroes]]

attachments.fallback: Solidarity of Heroes {1}{G} // Instant // Strive — Solidarity of Heroes costs {1}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first. // Choose any number of target creatures. Double the number of +1/+1 counters on each of them.
attachments.text:
Instant
_Strive_ — Solidarity of Heroes costs {1}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target creatures. Double the number of +1/+1 counters on each of them.
attachments.title: Solidarity of Heroes {1}{G}

text: Maybe I'm wrong, it sounds like we're melding Inspiring Call with Heroic Intervention... Still
Oh, okay. That's what I thought it was, I was wrong.
Inspiring call is one of my favorite cards. It's just a beating if you have any board presence
It's a legit win-con in a counters deck
Er, Solidarity I mean
Call did work in the deck though too
Played C17 Dragons vs. Vampires today, Monastery Siege slowed it down a lot, picking dragons (spells targeting me or my permanents cost 2 more) think that's worth it in Jenara to protect her a bit?
1/1 counters is a build I need to have, but I just have never been able to get it where I want. Trying to do too many things often times
I tried Vorel, Vorosh, Mimeoplasm and Jenara and thought Mimeo worked best. Axtraxa existing kinda deflated me on the deck though
Yeah, I could see that. Atraxa is an annoyingly good Commander
<http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/mocl-jenara-asura-of-war/> Current list is less than 15 TIX

attachments.title: MTG Deck: #MOCL | Jenara, Asura of War

text:
Yea, She's a commander in surprised I haven't built yet. Probably the whole "everyone and their mom" built it.

So I tried searching EDHREC for decks like my current Scarab God deck for ideas... three decks total, one of which is mine
Really? Crazy! I built him budget, too. Did alright until Locust God combo'd off O.o
Yea, mine is built with a theft theme. Time will tell if it's any good. Nightveil Specter, Kheru Mind Eater, and the like.
Nice. I just went mill and steal from the graveyard. Wasn't super confident in tribal zombies. Why not steal the best things from others and MAKE them zombies?

I LOVE Scarab God. I'm playing just run of the mill tribal zombies, but the beauty of the deck is how it can seamlessly be an aggro tribal deck, then start playing control with removal creatures (like fleshbag and other people's stuff) and back into aggro
It's so resilient
Yes! Ot
It's a really solid deck
Hoses obnoxious decks like Meren and Karandor which feels great
I'm sad that Locust seems unstoppable unless you basically single-target/obliterate them first
Doesn't care about GY hate it's self cause it can just go beat down
Yeah but like, locust god is a one trick pony
Locust is too linear for me. There's really only one way to build it.
It's a sweet
lol yeah that
Scarab does it allllll
Yeah, Locust is linear but it does what it does VERY WELL.
That's what linear decks do.
Yup
I've seen several and they are invariably all the same.
Skull clamp plus ashnod's or mana echoes?
Teferi's puzzle box, etc.
All the wheel effects, yeah.
That's pretty boring to me but that's just my preference.
It's kind of like the mono black deck that just tutors out blood and bond then taps pristine talisman
Well yes, that deck is stupid.
I don't disagree with that statement.
Just played against that very deck right now.
Did you kill the pilot?
No, sadly I was stuck drawing land and the precon guy decided to kill me first.
... Yeah, sounds right
Those precon guys are the worst.
They are people after all
I mean, barely :wink:
It was a Mike deck so he had Trike, etc.
(I've been playing the precons 1v1 with my wife the past week or so, that's why it's supposed to be funny)

I was playing Stitcher, which is my lower power deck since I was playing against 2 precons, and purposefully put Training Grounds and Intruder Alarm to the bottom in early scrys to not go off, but that guy had no such compunction.
Yeah, obviously. That sucks. Tryhards can be annoying when there's people with lower tiered decks.
It's one thing when everyone's got mid- or top-tier decks against one another, but precons aren't typically super strong.
Wheels and Shared Animosity

This last Thursday, I had a guy rage quit a game after first saying "I'm not going to try to combo early", then tried to stick Peregrine Drake + Eldrazi Displacer. I stopped that with Containment Priest. He got mad that I kept attacking after that.
Well, at least he didn't try to combo off early
That was only because he was stuck on lands for the first half of the game.
Oh. Sorry, missed you were responding to <@U3NH6MY1X>
<https://twitter.com/norbert88/status/907067130390175746>
lololol
Oh Norbert...
the guy jsut wants to follow him
ITS ALL HE WANTS
FOR HIS CHILD TO GROW UP IN A HOUSE THAT ISNT BLOCKED BY <@U32LRG9NU>
Jason can literally make his dreams come true.
oh
looks like jason unblocked him
What a happy ending
he fell for it
he let his guard down
now the guy will ask him how he can make his 80% deck better when the reserve list gets abolished
I was going to say something, but then realized that I've already lost my dignity by wasting my time to comment on someone that uses twitter. Shame on me.
Oh, that's Mason!
From the deck testing group
ok want to get some brainstormy advice for a new feature
i want to make it easier to see budget decks (and perhaps the opposite, baller budgets)
i have two ideas
one, is to do something like the theme selection, but for budget. You’d have 3 options, budget, don’t care, and $$$
*anticipation builds*
So do you call really fancy deck 'ball busters'?
Pinkies out, we fancy.

other option, is to make `<http://budget.edhrec.com|budget.edhrec.com>` in which it’s a mirror of the site, but the underlying data is only budget decks. this would also fundamentally change the theme,tribal pages, top pages, and recs
I don't really like the mirror site option.
Would it be easier to just click a filter vs. a 'whole' site?
That's what I'm thinking.
i guess thats what im asking. this isn’t a feature i personally care about so im having trouble designing it
Perhaps use <@U32LRG9NU> language and call them 'decks for poors'
<http://poors.edhrec.com|poors.edhrec.com>
Savage
The mirror site feels counterintuitive to me
the cool thing about the mirror site is you could see top budget cards, top budget commanders, etc.
How do you classify a 'budget' deck? $50? $75?
That's the biggest hurdle.
im not sure i need to do some data analysis. but it’s either going to be a $ cutoff or a lowest 10% percentile or something
It seems the easy way would be to allow the user to define that.
You could have a field at the top of the page or as a filter and let them set the budget 'max' for a card or the deck....
ok so there are some technical limitations here
1. per card filtering is not something we can do right now
Oh @don...all it takes is some time and code...
if we do the work for that we are going to redesign the entire page
:smiling_imp:
For example, I click the radio button or whatever to make the budget filter active. That makes the budget field modifiable and I define the max budget for the site to parse.
Can't you just add a filter for price of cards? If I can't spend more than $10 per card, I hide anything higher and go with that
no i cant do that <@U6YMA7NAV>
i mean i can but it’s over a threshold where i might as well just rebuild the page how i want it
Yeah....I don't think they store price data
Yeah per card is not the way to go anyways.
ok so #2, i need to know the budget cutoff ahead of time
You would want to do it by total deck price.
It might be for some people...

so you can filter by price right now in advanced filters:
<https://edhrec.com/commanders/marath-will-of-the-wild?f=d%3Alt%3D150>

attachments.title: EDHREC - Marath, Will of the Wild Commander Analysis
attachments.text: EDH/Commander Recommendations: Opal Palace, Gahiji Honored One, Boros Guildgate, Naya Panorama, Gruul Guildgate, Warstorm Surge

text: That's great, but it's already been noted that it's a technical limitation. The desire is moot.
How current is that pricing and what's the source? CK?
ck yes
daily updates
Then that's per card...

Fair enough. I don't know how the backend of the site works. I know I see prices in my search, but it makes sense you don't store that info as an attribute per card. Would be hell on a database to add it, too.
daily i update deck prices
i have a table that links each deck in my database to its total cost
which is how i can do the advanced filter on price
Each deck? So the price is the summation of all card prices on the filtered page?
i have 210k individual 100 card decks
each one i sum the cards in that deck to get the total deck price
So the adv filter on price is $150 for all cards you show on the results?

the thing will go:

Get all Marath Decks -> Only keep ones that are <$150 -> get averages, calculate synergy scores etc -> render page
Wait, then if it's already checking individual card prices then why is it a technical impossibility to have a manually defined per card filter?
its a UI problem <@U6LUSCS1J>
Ok that makes sense
it’s easier for us to reimplement the page than it would be to do that, we decided
and that’s a lot of work
Yeah I get it. I did UI in college it's a pain in the ass.
well if we did it better the first time it would hae been easier
haha
Ok, I get it...now, having actually tinkered with it a bit.
so anyways, this confusion about how this actually fucking works is the problem. it’s not that intuitive. that’s why having a “budget” button is something i want to do
The age old issue of form vs. function
Yeah, UX is almost always the hardest part of site design.

Seems fair. I think your biggest hurdle, as you stated, will be setting numbers to the tiers. You're essentially setting the standard. The more people use edhrec, the more that standard gets recognized so you want to stick on a good number.
also note that if i set the threshold to $150, the average is going to be more like $90 or something
Given that knowledge I think the best approach is to set a table like we have for theme selections.
Make the default page load "no limits".
kk, that’s definitely easier
Allow the user to choose from the table whatever presets seem fair.
the mirror site i thought was a cool idea though. could make it link between the two easy but yeah
honestly it would be probably 5x as much work too
so if the table selection iwll work that’s cool
You won't make everyone happy, but you never will, so do what works for now and make it part of the next EDHREC redesign.
>$100 is always going to be a popular choice for budget folks.
Whoa I meant to type less than $100
i think the problem with redesign is we have cool features that improve functionality still to do
like we could work on redesign, or work on themes or budget options
Honestly, the Commander's Brew folks, and even authors here, use $50 for their budget decks.
That's fair.
not too many people complain about the UX, meanwhile i get emails asking about how to make budget decks
i was thinking of doing two tiers for budgets anyways. Maybe I cna make one $50 and another $150
something like that
I could see $50 being the lowest option.
Yeah that would work.
Most budget folks will probably look at $50/$100/$150. After that, I suspect folks don't look at 'budget' per say but power level.
so $100 threshold gives me 11% of my decks
<@U3L7A68JC> is right
so if i set the threshold for $100, the average deckprice would be $65
Beyond $150 it's too marginal of a demographic. Most folks beyond that bracket care about budget.

```
postgres=# SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM deckswithprices WHERE price < 100) / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM deckswithprices)::float;
     ?column?      
-------------------
 0.110981855259194
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT AVG(price) FROM deckswithprices WHERE price < 100;
       avg        
------------------
 65.6491292909044
(1 row)

```

```
postgres=# SELECT AVG(price) FROM deckswithprices WHERE price < 150;
       avg        
------------------
 94.3784758276298
(1 row)
```
if i set threshold to 150, average deck price is $95
You trying to get me all hot with SQL before bed time?
wow
$150 is twice as many decks as $100
See, that's the sweet spot.
10% of all my decks are between $100-$150
time for a histogram
I suspect a lot of that is where most upgrades precons fall. The value of the precons is always, on a per card basis, over $100.
I bet you're right.
Can you filter deck prices excluding the price of the Commander?
Great question.
That's relevant, I almost never factor that in as I've already got my commander well in advance of building the deck.
yes i was not planning on including the cost of the commander, because that would seriously jack up a lot of the results
a budget angus mackenzie deck would be funny, but if i did it that way there would be no decks to list haha
Those previous queries included the Commander or not?
they inculded commander
note the max is $25k :smile:
haha
<http://deckstats.net/decks/28423/175663-banlist-edh>

text: Is that possible without the power 9
nope
Setting the threshold at $150 seems to be pretty good. That would put the average deck cost in there at $100. Below 61 is just too few decks
That sounds fair.
Can you make the top cards in that threshold appear specifically as a budget top 100?
Or even a top 10 generals for that bracket?
yeah i think so
top cards in budget decks, etc.
id probably do that as a phase 2
Awesome. I can't wait to see it. I could see this getting a fair bit of use.
You'll have to ensure to spell out that you're looking at deck AVERAGES vs. hard prices.
Good point
i hope that in general the results are good and its obviously better at showing cards that are more budgety
like yeah, id consider these cards for my budget build or whatev
taking my results too literally is never good haha
I can see this being a big thing as EDH attracts a lot of budget conscious players.
a large portion of my userbase are casual edh players
and new players
i think
Yeah most of the try hards congregate on reddit or the forums I think.
crazy thing happened today
talked to a cousin i havent talked to in years, found out he plays magic, then find out he plays edh
runs in the family i guess
i then ask him if hes heard of edhrec, hes like “yeah why? im looking at Kess right now”
Did you tell him you happen to know a guy with a site?
haha
That's effing priceless.
So I posted the article in the various edh groups I'm a part of on Facebook. Seems to be good so far. It's late so I'm sure there will be more responses tomorrow.
<@U6LUSCS1J> There's a lot of relatively casual players who pimp their edh decks.
More players than not at my shop are working at least one foil deck. They may be multi-year projects but they're doing it despite not being cuthtroat players.
ive got two decks foiled out
cards left are a bitch
verdant catacombs needs to be expedition (the other 3 are expeditions)
dark confidant i want an old border foil
mind twist i think i want a beta, but i might settle for the invocation
if anyone has any of those for trade/sale let me know :slightly_smiling_face:
judge foil wheel at $250
fml
might be easier to cut wheel from the deck and add an ecnahtnment :joy:
I know <@U4V5EHQ2G>. I'm aware that foiling is a thing for casuals and hardcores alike in this community, unlike normal constructed magic. I think it's kinda cool even though it's not a thing for me.
I'll just post the imagur to mine: <http://imgur.com/a/k9hjC>

text: Working on Sphinxes too, but that one isn't terrible, and I didn't go balls out, settling for stuff like a Khans pack Flooded Strand, etc. Just missing a Cavern of Souls. Working Reki too but that one is much further off
One thing about the judge foil Wheel is it's not like it's gonna drop, but yeah, $250 suuucks.
